image.altText: A saltwater crocodile lurking in the shallows of a clear body of water.

props.synopsis: Queensland police believe a teenager who went missing on Thursday was killed by a crocodile after a boat broke down off Saibai Island in the far northern reaches of the Torres Strait.

title.children: Searchers suspect missing teen attacked by crocodile after body found on Torres Strait beach

image.altText: a chemist testing a drug sample

props.synopsis: A new permanent drug testing site in Brisbane will allow people to have small samples of illicit drugs tested for free to see if they contain dangerous chemicals.

title.children: Within two hours of a high-risk drug being tested, an alert will be published on social media to warn others

image.altText: A fighter jet sits on a runway

props.synopsis: Iranian state media has reported that explosions have been heard at Isfahan airport in central Iran, amid conflicting reports from US and Iranian officials about what caused them.

title.children: Iran's air defences activated amid reports of Israeli strike near city of Isfahan

image.altText: Woman looks solemn while standing at beach.

props.synopsis: High inflation means many workers' HECS debts are growing faster than they can pay it off.Â It shows why calls for change have grown so loud that the prime minister has all but confirmed there will be HECS relief in the budget, national education and parenting reporter Conor Duffy writes.

title.children: The 'student debt spiral': How HECS loans have ballooned in the past decade

image.altText: dark ominous clouds over houses in the suburb of beechwood as a storm from approaches

props.synopsis: Australia's weatherÂ will serve up a smorgasbord of variability this weekend, with an expected drenching for the east, wintry nights in the southern states and ongoing heat in the west.

title.children: East coast to soak over the weekend amid possible cyclone, frosty south â and endless WA heat

image.altText: An aerial shot shows rows of houses.

props.synopsis: Property investors in New Zealand have had several years with a reduced ability to claim their interest payments as a tax deduction, but the new Coalition government has brought it back.

title.children: Jacinda Ardern slashed negative gearing in NZ. Did it drive down house prices?

image.altText: Retiring AFL player Nathan Murphy sitting on a couch wearing a jumper and pants.

props.synopsis: How does it feel to step away from an elite sporting career at just 24-years-old? Footballer Nathan Murphy opens up to Hack on the six months since his career-ending concussion.

title.children: Nathan Murphy speaks out on concussion, panic attacks, and loneliness after AFL retirement at 24

image.altText: Dugong swimming at the surface of the water.

props.synopsis: The battle over a proposed development on Toondah Harbour may have been won, but the fight to protect the dugong and Quandamooka traditions continues at Moreton Bay.

title.children: This 8-year-old is learning to hunt dugong. He's also trying to save them

image.altText: Three unidentifiable people sit in a darkened room.

props.synopsis: The parents of a 10-year-old boy who was under the care of the WA Department of Communities when he took his own life on Saturday speak of the moment they were told their son had died, and why they feel he has been swept "under the rug".

title.children: 'It bloody hurts': Parents of 10yo who took his own life in state care speak of devastation, hit out at government

image.altText: Kieran Loveridge

props.synopsis: Kieran Loveridge, who was convicted of the manslaughter of Thomas Kelly after punching him during a night out in Kings Cross in 2012, is being released from Broken Hill Correctional Centre after serving 11 years behind bars.

title.children: One-punch attacker set free after spending 11 years behind bars

image.altText: A woman smiles and poses for a photo that has been overlayed with a sepia filter, adjusting the colour to give it a yellow tone

props.synopsis: Police say an autopsy of the body of Rachael Dixon who died at a retreat near Ballarat has found no cause of death.

title.children: Cause of Melbourne woman's death at wellness retreat is unknown, police say

image.altText: An unidentified person looks at a screen with property for rent on it.

props.synopsis: An error made by the owner meant Sarah became the sole tenant on the lease for a bargain price, but months later, people started showing up at her door.

title.children: When Sarah secured a family home near Brisbane for $115 a week, she had no idea of the nightmare that would follow

image.altText: Man looking off camera

props.synopsis: Security officerÂ Muhammad Taha has officially been granted a permanent resident visa by the government after he confronted Joel Cauchi during Saturday's mass stabbing at Westfield Bondi Junction.

title.children: Security guard stabbed during confrontation with Bondi mass murderer granted permanent visa

image.altText: Police tape wrapped around a metal pole.

props.synopsis: Ongoing police patrols at shopping centres and tougher penalties for people caught carrying knives are among the suggestions being put forward by politicians following the Sydney stabbing attacks.Â

title.children: Bipartisan federal support for tougher knife laws after Sydney attacks

image.altText: Queensland premier Steven Miles with  Reece Mortensen and Juliette Wells and Molly and Peggy

props.synopsis: Following a sustained campaign to return Molly to a family and their dogs, Queensland Premier Steven Miles threw his support behind reuniting them. But he denies bowing to social media pressure to intervene in the case.

title.children: Premier denies bowing to social media pressure as he visits returnee Molly the magpie at home

image.altText: A rugby league player celebrates a try with his teammates

props.synopsis: Parramatta halfback Dylan Brown has called his side's performance against the Dolphins "weak, embarrassing" after they gave up eight tries in the second half.

title.children: Parramatta lament 'weak, embarrassing' belting to the Dolphins

image.altText: Essendon players celebrate will an umpire signals for full-time

props.synopsis: A controversial umpiring decision in the final seconds of the game leaves Adelaide enraged while Essendon celebrates a hard-earned three-point win.

title.children: Bombers prevail while Crows fume as contentious decision denies Adelaide chance to steal win

image.altText: Two police officers updating the media

props.synopsis: The teenager's case was heard before a children's court where his lawyer argued he has a long history of mental health issues dating back to his childhood.Â

title.children: Court told teenager 'had long history' of mental health issues before allegedly stabbing bishop

image.altText: A closeup of a man with a beard and glasses

props.synopsis: India's prime minister has set himself an ambitious goal in the country's marathon six-week election, but to achieve it, he'll have to win over a dubious crowd.

title.children: India's south has always been immune to Modi's charms. Here's why he's desperate to win them over

image.altText: a blurred image of a boy holding a knife to a woman on the street

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have arrested four boys, including two aged 11, over an alleged daylight carjacking in Darwin that left a nurse traumatised.Â

title.children: Four boys arrested over 'terrifying' alleged knifepoint carjacking in Darwin CBD

image.altText: five colourful vapes standing on a black-coloured counter

props.synopsis: Health ministers from around the country have backed the federal government's proposed vaping bans, arguing e-cigarettes are being used as a tool to recruit new smokers.

title.children: States argue vapes 'recruiting a new generation to nicotine', urging federal parliament to enact bans

image.altText: A person wearing a high-vis vest with 'mental health' written on the back stands on a street.

props.synopsis: The sister of a man whose schizophrenia diagnosis has been part of her family's life for 30 years says the mental health system, as she has experienced it, is non-existent.

title.children: Trauma of family's lifetime with mental health system brought home by Bondi killings

props.synopsis: In Samoa, churches spend millions building cathedrals to connect communities to God. But as debts and poverty skyrocket, many are questioning the price tag.

title.children: 'Enough is enough': Cost of cathedral building questioned as many struggle to make ends meet

image.altText: Three women smile for a camera while wearing designer clothing.

props.synopsis: There is a real-time example playing out on the world stage of how salaries are impacted by structures that were built for men decades before anyone thought to include women.

title.children: Caitlin Clark is this year's number one draft pick in the WNBA. Her salary has sparked outrage

image.altText: A composite image of a young woman wearing goggles, and aÂ sparking cut sapphire.

props.synopsis: A small group of sapphire miners celebrate as the Queensland government abandons a proposal to stop the renewal of small-scale mining tenures beyond 15 years.

title.children: Gem hunters victorious in 'David versus Goliath' battle to keep mining claims long-term

image.altText: Mr Suidani in a garden, closer this time

props.synopsis: Early results are starting to flow in Solomon Islands in the wake of Wednesday's elections, with prominent China critic, ousted Malaita premier Daniel Suidani, regaining his provincial seat.Â

title.children: China critic regains seat in Solomon Islands, vows to block Chinese investment as election counting continues

image.altText: Baby zebra lies on the ground

props.synopsis: The new baby was born earlier this week. Zookeepers can't get close enough yet to check its sex and weight but said it is already showing signs of a cheeky personality.

title.children: Canberra zoo's new zebra foal, born into successful breeding program, is already doing 'zoomies'

image.altText: A person sitting in a stairwell

props.synopsis: Tyler became homeless at the age of 16,Â spending the next two years couch surfing with friends and co-workers while finishing school and working a job to survive.

title.children: How Tyler worked and finished high school as a homeless teen under a cloud of guilt and shame

image.altText: The cast of The Wiggles pose for a group photo in their skivvies.

props.synopsis: The Wiggles most popular songs, including Hot Potato and Fruit Salad, feature on the group's newÂ electronic dance album.

title.children: The Wiggles release dance album boasting rave remixes of their biggest hits

image.altText: Samuel Pupo

props.synopsis: Brazilian surfer Samuel Pupo is reduced to tears after beating his older brother at the Margaret River Pro, and knocking him off the tour as a result.

title.children: Surfer left in tears at Margaret River Pro after emotional battle with older brother

image.altText: owner with her dog

props.synopsis: Trialling sheepdogs in Australia has a long history, with many competitors travelling year-round to compete at rural and remote events, and for others it's their "getaway from the farm".

title.children: 'It's my getaway': Farmers and their mates muster fierce, friendly rivalry at Australia's top dog competition

image.altText: a generic image of a child standing by a window holding a doll. the light is shadowy and their identity isn't clear

props.synopsis: The death of a 10-year-old Indigenous boy raises serious questions about how well the system is coping with a surge in children in state care in Western Australia.Â WARNING: This story contains distressing content.

title.children: 'Unspeakable tragedy': Boy's suicide in state care prompts doubts about system's ability to cope

image.altText: Angry woman punching her screen

props.synopsis: Anger and fear dominate our world right now, but experts say those who are engineering these emotions are often doing so for the money.

title.children: Why are we all so angry right now? Many experts say we're being manipulated for profitsÂ

image.altText: A prop car in a forest

props.synopsis: In a beloved Melbourne wildlife reserve, Warner Brothers was given the green light to conjure up fantastical scenes straight from Harry Potter. But behind the scenes, the local council was warned this would risk banishing their own, real-world creatures.

title.children: A Harry Potter experience got a barrage of public backlash, but documents suggest it could've been avoided
